metadata.title: CVE-2019-11765 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A compromised content process could send a message to the parent processthat would cause the 'Click to Play' permission prompt to be shown.However, due to lack of validation from the parent process, if the useraccepted the permission request an attacker-controlled permission would begranted rather than the 'Click to Play' permission. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 70.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11765` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '70.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
